entries.title: Hillcrest School Victims to Be Remembered
entries.description: Sandra Cruz Torres, mother of Robb Elementary shooting victim Eliahna Torres, chats with Beto O'Rourke, Democratic candidate running for governor, as Cruz and her family celebrate Día de los Muertos at Torres' gravesite in Hillcrest Memorial Cemetery in Uvalde, Texas, on Nov. 2, 2022. (Sam Owens/The San Antonio Express-News via AP)

entries.title: Premiers Want to Maintain ‘Futile Fight’ Over Federal Health Transfer Dollars, Says Minister Duclos
entries.description: Minister of Health Jean-Yves Duclos rises during question period on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Oct. 31, 2022. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Trudeau Responds to Privy Council Document Citing ‘Active Foreign Interference Network’
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau takes part in a year-end interview with The Canadian Press in Ottawa on Dec. 12, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Sean Kilpatrick)

entries.title: Emergency Room Wait Times Up Across Canada: Federal Data
entries.description: A health care worker makes his way into the Emergency Department of the Vancouver General Hospital in Vancouver on March 30, 2020. (Jonathan Hayward/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: BC MLAs Vote Unanimously to Freeze Politicians’ Salary Increases for 2023
entries.description: Todd Stone speaks during a B.C. Liberal Leadership debate in Vancouver, B.C., on Jan. 23, 2018. (Ben Nelms/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Eastern Quebec Bus Crash Kills Two People, Leaves Many in Hospital
entries.description: An ambulance drives up to a hospital in Longueuill, Quebec. (The Canadian Press/Ryan Remiorz)

entries.title: New NS Top Mountie Says Public Wants to Keep Force Despite Mass Shooting Response
entries.description: Assistant Commissioner Dennis Daley, the new commanding officer of the Nova Scotia RCMP, poses at RCMP headquarters in Dartmouth, N.S. on Dec. 14, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darren Calabrese)

entries.title: Canada Not Sending Fighter Jets to Europe Next Year as Air Force Rearms, Regroups
entries.description: A CF-18 Hornet sits on the tarmac at Canadian Forces Base Trenton, in Trenton, Ont., on June 20, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Lars Hagberg)

entries.title: Canada Beefing up Haiti Embassy in Push for Political Consensus
entries.description: Canadian Ambassador to the United Nations Bob Rae makes his way to speak to media at the United Nations in New York on Sept. 20, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Sean Kilpatrick)

entries.title: Canadian Lawmakers Vote to Make Anti-Forced Organ Harvesting Bill Law
entries.description: Falun Gong practitioners in Vienna, Austria, stage a mock demonstration of organ harvesting of fellow adherents in China on Oct. 1, 2018.  (Joe Klamar/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Policy Expert Writes ‘Reality Check’ on Canada’s Emission Reduction Plan
entries.description: A charging port is seen on a Mercedes Benz EQC 400 4Matic electric vehicle at the Canadian International AutoShow in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Feb. 13, 2019. (Mark Blinch/Reuters)

entries.description: Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) servicemen stand in front of the entrance of Kyiv Pechersk Lavra monastery in Kyiv on Nov. 22, 2022, (Sergei Chuzavkov/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: US Military Creates New Space Force Unit in South Korea Amid North’s Threat
entries.description: Members of the newly activated U.S. Space Forces Korea (USSFK) stand in formation during the unit’s activation ceremony at Osan Air Base, Republic of Korea, on Dec. 14, 2022. (Courtesy of Staff Sgt. Skyler Combs via U.S. Space Forces Korea)

entries.title: 400% More Ontario Patients Dying While Awaiting CT and MRI Scans: Report
entries.description: An image of a patient’s brain is displayed on a monitor screen as she lies in a MRI machine at Toronto's Sunnybrook Hospital on May 1, 2018. (Chris Young/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Nearly 18% of Toronto Family Doctors Planning to Close Their Practice Within 5 Years: Poll
entries.description: Nearly 18 percent of family doctors based in the Toronto area are considering closing their doors within the next five years, according to a recent survey. (Carl Court/Getty Images)

entries.title: New Poll Finds Canadians Not Using All Vacation, Working Extra Hours Before Holidays
entries.description: A man walks though a downtown Toronto office building with other buildings reflected in a window in this June 11, 2019 photo. (The Canadian Press/Graeme Roy)

entries.title: 4 Dead After Boat Carrying Illegal Immigrants to UK Capsizes in English Channel
entries.description: Members of the Dover lifeboat place a body bag on a stretcher after returning to the Port of Dover following a large search and rescue operation launched in the English Channel off the coast of Dungeness, in Kent, southeast England, on Dec. 14, 2022. (Gareth Fuller/PA Media)

entries.title: Poilievre Tells Tory Caucus to ‘Stand’ With the ‘Common People’ in Year End Address

entries.title: National Crime Agency Officer Denies Deleting Missing EncroChat Document
entries.description: Campaigners against the National Crime Agency's use of data hacked from EncroChat by French police protest outside the Old Bailey in London on May 27, 2022. (Chris Summers/The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Investment Canada Act Update Part of Restructuring Globalization Away From China: Business Professor

entries.title: Beijing Recalls Diplomats Wanted for Questioning by UK Police Over Consulate Attack
entries.description: Hongkongers holding a rally outside the Chinese Consulate in Manchester, UK, were dragged into the consulate and beaten by the staff, on Oct. 16, 2022. (Screenshot via Hong Kong Indigenous Defense Force)

entries.title: Transport Canada Must Be ‘More Vigilant,’ Relatives Say Two Years After NS Sinking
entries.description: Michael Francis, whose father Eugene Francis perished when the scallop dragger Chief William Saulis sank in the Bay of Fundy, remembers his dad at home in Milton, N.S. on Nov. 30, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Andrew Vaughan)

entries.title: Woman, 23, Dies in Australia After Falling From Cruise Ship

entries.title: Scottish Judge Rules ‘Sex’ Is Not Limited to Biological or Birth Sex
entries.description: Members of the public take part in a women’s rights demo against the Scottish government’s decision to allow self-declaration of sex in the 2022 census, in Edinburgh, on Sept. 2, 2021. (Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images)

entries.title: Met Police Chief Clashes With Diane Abbott Over Stop-and-Search and Gangs Matrix
entries.description: The Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police, Sir Mark Rowley, takes an oath to King Charles III at New Scotland Yard in central London on Sept. 12, 2022. (PA)

entries.description: A customer shops for food items inside a Tesco supermarket store in east London, on Jan. 10, 2022. (Daniel Leal/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Messi Confirms Qatar Final Will Be His Last World Cup Game
entries.description: Argentina's Lionel Messi celebrates after Julian Alvarez scores their third goal in the match of Argentina versus Croatia, during the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 in Lusail Stadium, Lusail, Qatar, on Dec. 13, 2022. (Kai Pfaffenbach/Reuters)

entries.title: Hong Kong Delays Jimmy Lai’s Security Trial as British Lawyer’s Visa Extension Denied
entries.description: Hong Kong pro-democracy media mogul Jimmy Lai pushes through a media pack as he arrives at the West Kowloon court in Hong Kong on Sept. 3, 2020. (Isaac Lawrence/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: June 4th Activist Accused Earlier of Incitement Has Her Conviction Overturned After Appeal
entries.description: Tonyee Chow Hang-tung (C), the former vice-chairperson of the HK Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China (The Alliance), at a press conference on June 11, 2021. She was charged and convicted of inciting others to knowingly participate in an unauthorized assembly and sentenced to 15 months in prison earlier in 2022. After an appeal to the High Court, she had her conviction and sentence revoked on Dec. 14, 2022. (Sung Pi-lung/The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Michael Zwaagstra: A Christmas Wish List for Schools
entries.description: From improving school safety to using  more evidence-based curriculum and leaving politics out of the classroom—there are many things Canada's schools can improve on this year.  (Michael Loccisano/Getty Images)

entries.title: Danske Bank Pleads Guilty to US Fraud, Agrees to Forfeit $2 Billion: DOJ
entries.description: A branch of Danske Bank in Copenhagen, Denmark, in Jan. 23, 2014. (Jens Noergaard Larsen/AFP/Getty Images)

entries.title: FTX Boss Sam Bankman-Fried Denied Bail in Bahamas After Arrest, Faces up to 115 Years in Jail
entries.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried (2nd L) is led away handcuffed by officers of the Royal Bahamas Police Force in Nassau, Bahamas, on Dec. 13, 2022. (Mario Duncanson/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: New Zealand Places Lifetime Tobacco Ban on Young People in World-First Law
entries.description: A person shows off the new rubbish bins for smokers as part of the ACC plan to keep cigarette butts off the streets, in Auckland, New Zealand, on Dec. 10 2004. (Michael Bradley/Getty Images)

entries.title: US, South Korea, Japan Pledge Cooperation to Block North Korea Missile Financing
entries.description: U.S. Special Representative for North Korea Sung Kim (L), Japan Director-General for Asian and Oceanian Affairs Bureau Takehiro Funakoshi (C), and South Korea Special Representative for Korean Peninsula Peace and Security Affairs Kim Gunn pose for photographers prior to hold trilateral meeting on North Korea at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan in Tokyo on Sept. 7, 2022. (Eugene Hoshiko/AP Photo)

entries.title: Police Union Calls for Review of Australia’s Gun Licensing System After Deadly Ambush
entries.description: Weapons that were handed in are seen at the Victoria Police Forensic Services Centre in Melbourne, Australia, on Aug. 11, 2017. (Robert Cianflone/Getty Images)

entries.title: Several Provinces to Be Hit by ‘Widespread’ Winter Storm System Moving up From US
entries.description: Steam rises as people look out on Lake Ontario in front of the skyline during extreme cold weather in Toronto on Feb. 13, 2016. (The Canadian Press/Mark Blinch)

entries.title: 2 Crashes in Nepal Leave at Least 29 Dead, 22 Injured
entries.description: A helicopter flies with rescue team in front of the Annapurna mountain range in Pokhara, some 200 km west of Kathmandu, Nepal, on Jan. 22, 2020. (Prakash Mathema/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: BTS Member Jin Begins Military Duty at Front-Line Boot Camp
entries.description: South Korean army soldiers stand guard before K-pop band BTS's member Jin enters the army to serve near an army training center in Yeoncheon, South Korea, on Dec. 13, 2022. (Ahn Young-joon/AP Photo)

entries.title: Nestle to Launch New Ukraine Facility in Rare War-Time Investment

entries.title: Indonesia’s Criminalisation of Sex Outside of Marriage: A Threat to ‘Privacy’?

entries.title: Australian Authorities to Investigate Police Killers Motives
entries.description: Members of the local community take part in a vigil at Calamvale police station, Calamvale, south of Brisbane, Queensland in Australia on Dec. 13, 2022. Constables Matthew Arnold, 26, and Rachel McCrow, 29, died in an ambush and siege at a remote Queensland property. (AAP Image/Jono Searle)

entries.title: Christmas Strain Strangles Welfare Groups
entries.description: The Martin Place Christmas tree lights up in Sydney, Australia, on Nov. 28, 2020. (Brook Mitchell/Getty Images)

entries.title: Australian Women’s Swim Relay Team Break World Short Course Record
entries.description: Australia celebrate winning the Women’s 4x100m Freestyle Relay final during Day 1 of the 2022 FINA World Swimming Championships at the Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre in Melbourne, Tuesday, December 13, 2022. (AAP Image/Joel Carrett)
